title: I'm Starting to Appreciate Graves more

replies.body:
Have you read Burning Tides?  He features quite a bit in it, and I know it made me appreciate him a lot more - might do the same for others.  It's one of our longer stories, but it's broken into nice manageable chunks if you don't have a lot of time all at once.

https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/bilgewater-story/

{{champion:104}} {{champion:4}} {{champion:21}} {{champion:41}} 

(Ignore the weird pink chapter indications - it's a bug I think was introduced a little while ago, but the team have been made aware.  I blame Odyssey ;) )
Ooh, thanks for the link! I apologize, I've been getting into lore very recently, so I haven't been able to check out the content like Burning Tides yet, but thank you, I appreciate it!

No one asked for this opinion but I find Overwatch's lore (at least what little there actually is) too cheesy for me taste. 

Which im sure people could also say about League's but I see more development, depth and/or emotional gravity behind the characters in this world than the vapid, mostly white-washed one's in Overwatch. (Still irks me Reinhardt isn't very German, and the uncanny fact he didnt speak it in his CG)

Theres also Overwatch's aesthetic, which is a heck of a lot more kid friendly than League tries to be. Or even the heroes kit's are fairly linear in design, say what you want about League's most frustratingly design champs at least new characters like Ornn, Pyke, Zoe etc keep things fresh. 

Ik saying that in a forum for League is like a gun restriction advacite protesting in pro gun restriction cities, in other words 'a safe space'. I also don't play Overwatch, so that's an obvious bias but I dont play it because from its small roster of optional heroes none actually engage me in the slightest. Well it's more of a what could I get out of Overwatch that I can't get to some capacity in a free game like League.
I appreciate you voicing your opinion, and I actually agree with you for the most part, and just like you, I appreciate the new champs that come out, they're truly works of art lol.
Reinhardt is totally German dude. His Voice Actor is American which is why he doesn't speak it lol.

Sorry I intended to say that his voice actor isn't very German in accent. I love Darin De Paul, Im confident he could've done a more authentic tribute but the way he was instructed Blizzard clearly preferred whimsical ham over quality. 

Blizzard's approach to all the characters is like a child's idea of how people from different nationalities would look, sound and act. Like Overwatch has this real attitude for being progressive and representative of real life cultures, but squander that a bit with their fatuous gloss over everything. Star Trek still the best at matching these factors into an authentic, respectable, progressive, as well as kid friendly IP.
